body: Considered, and agreed! It should be done!

rename.from: Consider switching from pin-project to pin-project-lite

body:
This may require https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project-lite/pull/43.

UPDATE: merged and released in pin-project-lite 0.2.4.
I'll take a stab at implementing this.
Just found that out myself. Thanks for the link ðŸ™‚

issue.title: Switch to pin-project-lite
issue.body:
Will fix #2388.

~~Blocked on taiki-e/pin-project-lite#3.~~ ([workaround](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2388#issuecomment-758304097))
~~Blocked on taiki-e/pin-project-lite#25.~~ (see comment below)

body:
> Also depends on [taiki-e/pin-project-lite#3](https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project-lite/issues/3) because of
> 
> https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/c9c46ed60bd43484d67a98a63496ad0277c791a2/src/server/conn.rs#L163-L165

pin-project-lite#3 is about attributes that apply only to the original struct/enum.
Proper handling of cfg/cfg_attr on *fields and variants* requires a more complex approach than the fix for pin-project-lite#3 (it needs to be aware of the kind of attribute and propagate some of it to projected type). [Even pin-project could not find the correct solution other than "leave to the compiler"](https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project/issues/68#issuecomment-528318870). And it is impossible to use the same trick in pin-project-lite.

However, there is [a known workaround](https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project/issues/68#issuecomment-528318870) for the cfg issue, and probably hyper can use it as well.

> for now, it is preferable to create a type alias / new type or create structs for each `cfg`.

Something like:

```rust
#[cfg(all(feature = "http1", feature = "http2"))]
#[derive(Clone, Debug)]
enum Fallback<E> { ... }

#[cfg(not(all(feature = "http1", feature = "http2")))]
#[derive(Clone, Debug)]
struct Fallback<E>(std::marker::PhantomData<E>);

pin_project! {
    pub struct Connection<T, S, E = Exec>
    where
        S: HttpService<Body>,
    {
        pub(super) conn: Option<ProtoServer<T, S::ResBody, S, E>>,
        fallback: Fallback<E>,
    }
}
```

> pin-project-lite#3 is about attributes that apply only to the original struct/enum.

The title and issue description are exactly about this.

Anyway, thanks for providing a workaround, I'll apply that after taiki-e/pin-project-lite#25 is merged and I can finish my PR.
Hmm, by the way that struct is not using `#[pin]` at all, should it even be using `pin_project!`?

issue.title: Cannot interoperate with other field attributes

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue

repository.name: pin-project-lite
repository.description: A lightweight version of pin-project written with declarative macros.

body:
> The title and issue description are exactly about this.

Well, I agree that it is confusing.

> Hmm, by the way that struct is not using `#[pin]` at all, should it even be using `pin_project!`?

Technically, `pin_project!` is not required for types that do not use `#[pin]`.

> after [taiki-e/pin-project-lite#25](https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project-lite/pull/25) is merged

I think I can merge that this weekend or the next week. (it only needs docs and tests)

EDIT: It's no longer a blocker, so I postponed the merge.

issue.title: Remove useless uses of Pin
issue.body: While looking further into #2388 I noticed `UnboundedReceiver` was getting pinned even though [`UnboundedReceiver::poll_recv`](https://docs.rs/tokio/1.0.2/tokio/sync/mpsc/struct.UnboundedReceiver.html#method.poll_recv) takes `&mut self`. This detail was probably missed in the migration from tokio 0.3, which [previously used `Stream::poll_next`](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2369/files#diff-414def8886b02bb26f69e6e93e08fa35e230e7faf2b37cf1614cdf58fe987a5dL153-R154), but can now be applied, unblocking #2393.

body: I had to revert in https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2422, an issue was found after releasing: https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2421

issue.title: Revert pin project lite
issue.body:
It seems that the pin-project-lite isn't noticing the `cfg(feature = "..")` attributes on enum variants or fields, and *also* our CI didn't notice the failure of combining `--features http1,client,server`.

I'm reverting this change since it's the fastest way for me to unbreak and get a new release out.

Closes #2421 

cc @jplatte @taiki-e

body:
I had a look, [this is the problematic type](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2393/files#diff-bf5263b889c2bb696a1671b7d3778a67c468f73755166d3e4ed0410cb9acf109R80-R94): an enum that uses `#[cfg]` on its variants. The two solutions I can think of:

* always have the variant but containing an uninhabited type if the corresponding feature is disabled. Probably requires adding extra `Self::Foo { bar } => match bar {},` branches
* three declarations of the type for the three possible feature combinations (assuming that it just doesn't need to exist if both `http1` and `http2` are disabled, otherwise four)
Working on this again, using the first solution I mentioned above (if still applicable).
